Title: Die Verwandlung
Description: Ein surrealistisches Werk über die Metamorphose eines Mannes in ein Insekt.
Author: Franz Kafka

Title: Der Prozess
Description: Ein Mann wird ohne ersichtlichen Grund angeklagt und durchläuft ein labyrinthartiges Justizsystem.
Author: Franz Kafka

Title: Demian
Description: Eine Erzählung über einen jungen Mann und seinen spirituellen Weg.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Title: Siddhartha
Description: Die Reise eines jungen Mannes auf der Suche nach Erleuchtung.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Title: Faust
Description: Eine dramatische Geschichte über einen Gelehrten, der einen Pakt mit dem Teufel schließt.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Title: The Silent Patient
Description: Only she knows what happened.
Author: Alex Michaelides

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Description: A gripping tale of racial injustice in the Deep South.
Author: Harper Lee

Description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother.
Author: George Orwell

Title: The Great Gatsby
Description: A classic novel of the Roaring Twenties.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Title: Brave New World
Description: A dystopian vision of a future society.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Title: Moby Dick
Description: The epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsession with the white whale.
Author: Herman Melville

Title: War and Peace
Description: A panoramic view of Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Title: Crime and Punishment
Description: A psychological exploration of crime and guilt.
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Description: A classic tale of love and misunderstandings.
Author: Jane Austen

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Description: The story of a teenager's rebellion against the adult world.
Author: J.D. Salinger

Title: The Hobbit
Description: The adventures of Bilbo Baggins in Middle-earth.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Title: Anna Karenina
Description: A tragic tale of love and infidelity in Russian high society.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Title: The Odyssey
Description: Homer's epic tale of Odysseus' journey home.
Author: Homer

Title: The Divine Comedy
Description: Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Title: Les Misérables
Description: The story of Jean Valjean's quest for redemption.
Author: Victor Hugo

Title: A Tale of Two Cities
Description: A story of revolution and sacrifice set in London and Paris.
Author: Charles Dickens

Title: Ulysses
Description: A modernist novel that chronicles the experiences of Leopold Bloom in Dublin.
Author: James Joyce

Title: The Brothers Karamazov
Description: A philosophical novel exploring faith, doubt, and reason.
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

Title: Great Expectations
Description: The story of an orphan named Pip and his growth and personal development.
Author: Charles Dickens

Title: Wuthering Heights
Description: A story of passion and revenge on the Yorkshire moors.
Author: Emily Brontë

Title: Jane Eyre
Description: The life and trials of an orphaned girl who becomes a governess.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Title: The Old Man and The Sea
Description: The epic struggle of an old fisherman with a giant marlin.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Title: The Catch-22
Description: A satirical novel about the absurdities of war.
Author: Joseph Heller

Title: Heart of Darkness
Description: A voyage into the Congo Free State in search of a mysterious figure named Kurtz.
Author: Joseph Conrad

Title: The Road
Description: A post-apocalyptic tale of a father and son's journey to survive.
Author: Cormac McCarthy

Title: The Grapes of Wrath
Description: A story about the Joad family traveling from the Dust Bowl to California during the Great Depression.
Author: John Steinbeck

Title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Description: A novel about a man who remains young while his portrait ages.
Author: Oscar Wilde
